body: @hornn the reason we didn't want to bump up the pxf api version was we haven't quite made a release on hawq git based on v14 and wanted to stick to this version until then

@hornn we are not caching metadata in this stored procedure, we just use the same code path as for select from Hive tables, also we made it more generic. Please refer to JIRA https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HAWQ-393 and to design doc https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-P9eEfcS9SZGDMDRNc3xt8cluDL-BghICRhYz9F-MLU/edit.
I will change the code and pull a new request.
I had merged this PR, @armenatzoglou would you please close it ?
I had merged this PR, @gcaragea would you please close it ?
Thanks, will modify and submit for review again.
@randomtask1155 , please close this pull request since it's already been merged. Thanks.
@jfrank-pivotal , please close this pull request since it's already been merged. Thanks.
+1 over all. good work with using the stored procedure
@realdawn,  merged into master branch. Please close this PR.

Not sure I understood everything, so correct me if I am wrong. 
So right now we have two flows
1. For readable tables we append dfs_address in hd_work_mgr and parse it in pxfuriparser.
2. For writable tables we append dfs_address as part of the URI that is part of the external table context. Then we parse it in gpbridgeapi, but only in the export case (writable).
My question is - shouldn't we consolidate the two solutions and adopt the 2nd flow for both readable and writable?
Something wrong, I close this pull

Hi @gcaragea,

I had merged it to master branch, could you please close this PR? Thanks.

Hi @armenatzoglou,

I had merged it into branch master firstly. 

But I have a question: it seems that your fix doesn't fix the problem: 
(1) you just move the line  'queryEntry = NULL;'  one line( if clause ) ahead.
(2) moreover, the interrupt may occurs before the line 'queryEntry = NULL;' after called SyncHTRelease(). 

The solution I suggest: 
(1)If all memory and resource can be released even if WorkfileQueryspace_ReleaseEntry() not called. e.g. all memory palloced will be released for specific memory context released( transaction finished/statement execution finished....), then we can move the line 'queryEntry = NULL;'  to the line before calling SyncHTRelease().
(2) If cannot be auto-cleaned, then we should "HOLD_INTERRUPTS();" until we set  'queryEntry = NULL;' 

Thanks.

Hi @armenatzoglou ,

Please ignore the comments above. 
I look into the code of SyncHTRelease(), there is no calling 'CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPTS()' in this function or the functions it calls if there is no error reported. So your fix can work I think.

Please close this PR. Thanks.

@hornn @shivzone  Alternate implementation that handles both readable and writable case by setting a global var on segment after deserialization

I declared the var `dfs_address` in `fd.h` since that is where `enable_filesystem_credential` is declared there as well

I really like this solution - it looks really clean. 
What happens in the non secured case - do we always pass this var regardless?
In the non-secure case the `dfs_address` is not serialized and dispatched from the master so on the segment the global var will just be `NULL`
Closing since https://github.com/apache/incubator-hawq/pull/503 is a more complete solution
It would be better to utilize xml related utilities instead of re-implement it here again, i.e., append and update property in xml files. +1

+1. Merged into master branch. 

@xinzweb,  could you please help me to close this PR? Thanks.
@xinzweb , code merged, please close this PR. Thanks.

@denalex, please help to review this, since it can solve conflict with Ambari.

If Ambari already set 'default_hash_table_bucket_number' in hawq-site.xml, then hawq init will just use that value. 

Ambari also can give option '--default_hash_table_bucket_number' to 'hawq init master/cluster' command to specify the value. 

Thanks.

Some related changes:
1. Do not set GUC 'hawq_rm_nvseg_perquery_perseg_limit' any more since the default value is good enough.
2. Remove option ''--vsegment-number" since we do not need it any more.
3. Add new option "--bucket_number" to let user define GUC 'default_hash_table_bucket_number'.
@xunzhang thank you for your pull request and contribution to HAWQ! I would also want to loop in another contributor, Michael Schubert.

Merged to master: 87d13b673c19d0975cd2408c732c8c4836640e66, closing. 

@wengyanqing I think it would be better if you can preserve authorship when merging PRs. That way the original author can take the credit / blame for a fix :)

Merged to master by commit 536d99a6d1211ded20aaf502c0d70c2e8b5f9b52. 

Closing.
The logic looks good, great that you reused the calculation code, so we can guarantee the same value is calculated by Ambari and HAWQ.

I saw this warning in the build:

`This log is too long to be displayed. Please reduce the verbosity of your build or download the raw log.`

Due to what looks like Travis's limitation of 10,000 lines displayed for the build log, I would recommend you pipe non-essential information to a file and only print out in an error condition so you minimize the log noise and usually only see essential build output without having to look at the raw log.

you can do this for example with brew update: 

``` bash
brew update 2>&1 > /tmp/brew-update.txt || (cat /tmp/brew-update.txt && false)
```

Redirect stderr to stdout and if you get a non-zero exit, print out the logfile of what happened and stop the build. 

I think you would want to do this for everything in the `before_install` and in the `install` with the exception of libhdfs3 due to it being a tightly coupled and relevant dependency. Maybe move libhdfs3 down into the before_script to make that separation clear?

Hopefully with that all of the critical build steps relevant to HAWQ itself will be displayed the vast majority of the time to make it more developer friendly.

@schubert Thank you for the advice, I have modified the `brew update` and move libhdfs3 building into `before_script` in another commit. Since all `install` info take only less than 200 lines and travis will fold them automatically, I didn't modify `install` for the code simplicity. Check out https://travis-ci.org/xunzhang/incubator-hawq/builds/119114627.
Yup that looks like a better solution and you've got another 1300 log lines to spare. LGTM.
Already merged into master by @radarwave, so I will close.
